properties.name: template
properties.description: The template you want to send. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: fromEmail
properties.description: Email address of the sender optional with name

properties.name: toEmail
properties.description: Email address of the recipient. Multiple ones can be separated by comma.

options.name: async
options.description: Whether to enable a background sending mode that is optimized for bulk sending. In async mode, messages/send will immediately return a status of "queued" for every recipient. To handle rejections when sending in async mode, set up a webhook for the 'reject' event. Defaults to false for messages with no more than 10 recipients; messages with more than 10 recipients are always sent asynchronously, regardless of the value of async.

options.name: autoText
options.description: Whether or not to automatically generate a text part for messages that are not given text

options.name: autoHtml
options.description: Whether or not to automatically generate an HTML part for messages that are not given HTML

options.name: bccAddress
options.description: An optional address to receive an exact copy of each recipient's email

options.name: fromName
options.description: Optional from name to be used

options.name: googleAnalyticsCampaign
options.description: Optional string indicating the value to set for the utm_campaign tracking parameter. If this isn't provided the email's from address will be used instead.

options.name: googleAnalyticsDomains
options.description: An array of strings separated by a comma (,) indicating for which any matching URLs will automatically have Google Analytics parameters appended to their query string automatically

options.name: html
options.description: The html you want to send

options.name: important
options.description: Whether or not this message is important, and should be delivered ahead of non-important messages

options.name: inlineCss
options.description: Whether or not to automatically inline all CSS styles provided in the message HTML - only for HTML documents less than 256KB in size

options.name: ipPool
options.description: The name of the dedicated ip pool that should be used to send the message. If you do not have any dedicated IPs, this parameter has no effect. If you specify a pool that does not exist, your default pool will be used instead.

options.name: preserveRecipients
options.description: Whether or not to expose all recipients in to "To" header for each email

options.name: returnPathDomain
options.description: A custom domain to use for the messages's return-path

options.name: sendAt
options.description: When this message should be sent as a UTC timestamp in YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format. If you specify a time in the past, the message will be sent immediately. An additional fee applies for scheduled email, and this feature is only available to accounts with a positive balance.

options.name: signingDomain
options.description: A custom domain to use for SPF/DKIM signing instead of mandrill(for "via" or "on behalf of" in email clients)

options.name: subAccount
options.description: The unique ID of a subaccount for this message - must already exist or will fail with an error

options.name: subject
options.description: Subject line of the email

options.name: tags
options.description: An array of string separated by a comma (,) to tag the message with. Stats are accumulated using tags, though we only store the first 100 we see, so this should not be unique or change frequently. Tags should be 50 characters or less. Any tags starting with an underscore are reserved for internal use and will cause errors.

options.name: text
options.description: Example text content

options.name: trackClicks
options.description: Whether or not to turn on click tracking for the message

options.name: trackOpens
options.description: Whether or not to turn on open tracking for the message

options.name: trackingDomain
options.description: A custom domain to use for tracking opens and clicks instead of mandrillapp.com

options.name: urlStripQs
options.description: Whether or not to strip the query string from URLs when aggregating tracked URL data

options.name: viewContentLink
options.description: Whether to remove content logging for sensitive emails

options.description: Supplied elements will be treated as blocks (surrounded with blank lines)

options.description: Whether to open all links in new windows (by adding the attribute target="_blank" to <a> tags)

options.name: simplifiedAutoLink
options.description: Whether to enable automatic linking to URLs

options.name: backslashEscapesHTMLTags
options.description: Whether to support for HTML Tag escaping ex: <div>foo</div>

options.name: completeHTMLDocument
options.description: Whether to output a complete html document, including <html>, <head> and <body> tags instead of an HTML fragment

options.name: customizedHeaderId
options.description: Whether to use text in curly braces as header ID

options.name: emoji
options.description: Whether to enable emoji support. Ex: this is a :smile: emoji For more info on available emojis, see https://github.com/showdownjs/showdown/wiki/Emojis.

options.name: encodeEmails
options.description: Whether to enable e-mail addresses encoding through the use of Character Entities, transforming ASCII e-mail addresses into its equivalent decimal entities

options.name: excludeTrailingPunctuationFromURLs
options.description: Whether to exclude trailing punctuation from autolinking URLs. Punctuation excluded: . ! ? ( ). Only applies if simplifiedAutoLink option is set to true.

options.name: ghCodeBlocks
options.description: Whether to enable support for GFM code block style

options.name: ghCompatibleHeaderId
options.description: Whether to generate header IDs compatible with github style (spaces are replaced with dashes and a bunch of non alphanumeric chars are removed)

options.name: ghMentionsLink
options.description: Whether to change the link generated by @mentions. Showdown will replace {u} with the username. Only applies if ghMentions option is enabled.

options.name: ghMentions
options.description: Whether to enable github @mentions, which link to the username mentioned

options.name: tasklists
options.description: Whether to enable support for GFM tasklists

options.name: headerLevelStart
options.description: Whether to set the header starting level

options.name: requireSpaceBeforeHeadingText
options.description: Whether to make adding a space between # and the header text mandatory

options.name: literalMidWordAsterisks
options.description: Whether to stop showdown from interpreting asterisks in the middle of words as <em> and <strong> and instead treat them as literal asterisks

options.name: literalMidWordUnderscores
options.description: Whether to stop showdown from interpreting underscores in the middle of words as <em> and <strong> and instead treat them as literal underscores

options.name: noHeaderId
options.description: Whether to disable the automatic generation of header IDs

options.name: parseImgDimensions
options.description: Whether to enable support for setting image dimensions from within markdown syntax

options.name: prefixHeaderId
options.description: Add a prefix to the generated header IDs

options.name: rawHeaderId
options.description: Whether to remove only spaces, ' and " from generated header IDs (including prefixes), replacing them with dashes (-)

options.name: rawPrefixHeaderId
options.description: Whether to prevent showdown from modifying the prefix

options.name: simpleLineBreaks
options.description: Whether to parse line breaks as <br>, like GitHub does, without needing 2 spaces at the end of the line

options.name: smartIndentationFix
options.description: Whether to try to smartly fix indentation problems related to es6 template strings in the midst of indented code

options.name: disableForced4SpacesIndentedSublists
options.description: Whether to disable the requirement of indenting sublists by 4 spaces for them to be nested, effectively reverting to the old behavior where 2 or 3 spaces were enough

options.name: splitAdjacentBlockquotes
options.description: Whether to split adjacent blockquote blocks

options.name: strikethrough
options.description: Whether to enable support for strikethrough syntax

options.name: tablesHeaderId
options.description: Whether to add an ID property to table headers tags

options.name: tables
options.description: Whether to enable support for tables syntax

name: n8n-nodes-base.merge
description: Merges data of multiple streams once data from both is available

properties.displayName: New node version available: get the latest version with added features from the nodes panel.
properties.name: oldVersionNotice
mode

options.name: Append
options.description: Combines data of both inputs. The output will contain items of input 1 and input 2.

options.name: Keep Key Matches
options.description: Keeps data of input 1 if it does find a match with data of input 2

options.name: Merge By Index
options.description: Merges data of both inputs. The output will contain items of input 1 merged with data of input 2. Merge happens depending on the index of the items. So first item of input 1 will be merged with first item of input 2 and so on.

options.name: Merge By Key
options.description: Merges data of both inputs. The output will contain items of input 1 merged with data of input 2. Merge happens depending on a defined key.

options.name: Multiplex
options.description: Merges each value of one input with each value of the other input. The output will contain (m * n) items where (m) and (n) are lengths of the inputs.

options.name: Pass-Through
options.description: Passes through data of one input. The output will contain only items of the defined input.

options.name: Remove Key Matches
options.description: Keeps data of input 1 if it does NOT find match with data of input 2

options.name: Wait
options.description: Waits till data of both inputs is available and will then output a single empty item. Source Nodes must connect to both Input 1 and 2. This node only supports 2 Sources, if you need more Sources, connect multiple Merge nodes in series. This node will not output any data.

properties.description: How data of branches should be merged

properties.name: join

options.name: Inner Join
options.description: Merges as many items as both inputs contain. (Example: Input1 = 5 items, Input2 = 3 items | Output will contain 3 items).

options.name: Left Join
options.description: Merges as many items as first input contains. (Example: Input1 = 3 items, Input2 = 5 items | Output will contain 3 items).

options.name: Outer Join
options.description: Merges as many items as input contains with most items. (Example: Input1 = 3 items, Input2 = 5 items | Output will contain 5 items).

properties.description: How many items the output will contain if inputs contain different amount of items

properties.name: propertyName1
properties.hint: The name of the field as text (e.g. id)
properties.description: Name of property which decides which items to merge of input 1

properties.name: propertyName2
properties.hint: The name of the field as text (e.g. id)
properties.description: Name of property which decides which items to merge of input 2

properties.name: output
properties.description: Defines of which input the data should be used as output of node

properties.name: overwrite

options.name: Always
options.description: Always overwrites everything

options.name: If Blank
options.description: Overwrites only values of "null", "undefined" or empty string

options.name: If Missing
options.description: Only adds values which do not exist yet

properties.description: Select when to overwrite the values from Input1 with values from Input 2

name: n8n-nodes-base.microsoftOutlookTrigger
description: Fetches emails from Microsoft Outlook and starts the workflow on specified polling intervals.

properties.name: pollTimes
properties.description: Time at which polling should occur

values.name: mode
values.description: How often to trigger.

values.name: hour
values.description: The hour of the day to trigger (24h format)

values.name: minute
values.description: The minute of the day to trigger

values.name: dayOfMonth
values.description: The day of the month to trigger

values.name: weekday
values.description: The weekday to trigger

values.name: cronExpression
values.description:
Use custom cron expression. Values and ranges as follows:
  • Seconds: 0-59
  • Minutes: 0 - 59
  • Hours: 0 - 23
  • Day of Month: 1 - 31
  • Months: 0 - 11 (Jan - Dec)
  • Day of Week: 0 - 6 (Sun - Sat)

values.name: value
values.description: All how many X minutes/hours it should trigger

values.name: unit
values.description: If it should trigger all X minutes or hours
